note.p: The AGV has two travel modes

ul.li: Manual mode is mainly used for setup and troubleshooting. In manual operation, the AGV is controlled via a wired remote control. The trained operator is responsible for the travel. Travel can take place with or without load.

In automatic operation, the AGV receives its travel orders from a master computer (travel to position X, fetch load Y, and bring it to position Z), which are processed along the specified route. In automatic mode, the AGV can travel both with and without a load.
There is also a semi-automatic mode that allows the operator to specify the AGV target position.

li.p: The control screen and the main power switch are located on the AGV.

note.p: Use this power switch to turn the AGV on or off.

ul.li: This switch must always be in the "O" position during maintenance work.

note.p: If any E-Stop in the SBS system is pressed, the AGV and the rest of the system will stop.
The operator can use the SBS screens to stop operation, in which case the AGV completes its current order before stopping.

li.p: The main screen is shown on the right. To display the main screen when another screen is showing, click the Homebutton in the lower left corner of the screen.

ul.li: Status of battery, drives, temperature, network, WLAN

li.p: The top section of the main screen displays:

ul.li: Name of the AGV (on the left)
Battery charge state, shown with a battery and percent charge. A lightning symbol appears if the AGV is currently charging.
Stop symbol, which appears only when the vehicle has been stopped by the controller. (The reason for the stop is listed on the detail screen.)
